TopicTitle: Question: USI Kolonization with TAC Life Support?

Articles.Content:
Hi all.

I really like USI Kolonization Systems, but I really like TAC Life Support too. I want to know if there is an incompatibility between this two mods. I made the mistake of installing both USI and TAC Life support mods and trashed my career game. It took me several weeks of game to get there, so I would like to know this before hand

I'm not certain how this mods work, so forgive my ignorance if this is a stupid question.

Greetings

Zeke
This question about mods has been moved to the modding subforum. Good luck with it.
I used to use USI and I remember seeing that TAC is compatible, however I haven't a clue as to how it works.

It is completely supported according to what RoverDude said:

MKS introduces a series of parts specifically designed to provide self-sustaining life support for multiple Kerbals for users of USI-Life Support or (optionally) TAC-Life Support. While the parts will function without a life support mod, the design is centered around providing an appropriate challenge where players will weigh the costs, risks, and rewards of supplying missions exclusively with carried life support supplies, or in making the investment in a permanent colony. That being said, this is not just a single greenhouse part (although food production is part of the mod). Rather, it brings an entire colonization end-game to KSP in a fun and challenging way.
